sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Good morning, Europe. It is Tuesday, the 23rd of August. I'm Helena Humphrey. Here are your top stories.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Ukraine marks its national flag day, but President Zelenskyy bans public celebration as the country braces for more Russian attacks.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Moscow says Ukrainian special services were behind the car bomb that killed the daughter of a prominent Putin ally.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Kiev denies the allegations.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: And former US President Donald Trump is suing the Department of Justice to freeze the investigation into documents found at his Mar-a-Lago estate. Ukraine shows off captured Russian armoured vehicles before a city curfew in Kyiv.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: President Vladimir Zelensky has banned rallies marking the country's two annual celebrations, today's National Flag Day and Independence Day on Wednesday.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Ukraine fears an escalation of Russian attacks following the killing of the daughter of one of Vladimir Putin's allies in a car bombing near Moscow at the weekend.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: Dear Ukrainians, especially these days when we celebrate the day of our flag and the day of our independence, if you are somewhere abroad, please remind others about Ukraine there.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Be there with the Ukrainian flag and spread the truth about the crimes of the occupiers.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: The death toll in Russian rocket attacks on hostile dormitories in Ukraine's second-largest city of Kharkiv last week has risen to 25.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: The rescue operation ended on Monday with eight bodies still unidentified. Around 40 injured are recovering in hospitals. On the military front, almost 9,000 Ukrainian soldiers have been killed since Russia launched its invasion. It's the first time Ukraine's revealed the scale of its military losses. Meanwhile, under the threat of Russian attacks and a war that stopped all football in Ukraine, a new league season starts today.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: All games in the 16-team league will be played in and around Kyiv and further west.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: If the sirens sound, players must dash to bomb shelters in the stadiums.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The European Union says it could increase its military involvement in Ukraine's war effort.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: The 27 member states are considering combat training for Ukrainian soldiers in a major mission that, if it goes ahead, would take place in neighboring countries.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: EU Foreign Affairs Chief Joseph Borre justified its deliberations.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: It seems reasonable that a war that lasts and seems to be going to last should require an effort not only in terms of equipment supplies, but also in terms of training and for the organization of the army.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: And this is what is being discussed among the member states and will be discussed politically next week, next Monday in Prague, within the Council of Defence Ministers, and I hope that it will be approved.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Meanwhile as the war rumbles on, President Vladimir Putin chose National Flag Day to hail Russia's military glory and upholding of traditional values.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: The national flag, like the unfading red banner of victory, serves to educate the younger generation about the values of patriotism, citizenship and responsibility for the future of the motherland. Back in Ukraine, there is no respite.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Kyiv acknowledged on Monday that nearly 9,000 soldiers have been killed since the start of the conflict.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: And despite pleas from the international community, bombs have fallen again near the Zaporozhye nuclear power plant.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: These videos, supplied by Russian authorities, which have not been independently verified, show the alleged suspect in the death of Russian ultra-nationalist Daria Dugina, killed in a car bombing on Sunday.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Moscow says the suspect, a Ukrainian woman, has since fled to Estonia.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Vladimir Putin has described Dugina as a talented person with a real Russian heart, adding she proved by deed what it means to be a patriot of Russia.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The 29-year-old is the daughter of influential Russian political theorist Alexander Dugin, often referred to as Putin's brain.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: There are suspicions he was the intended target.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Dugin says our hearts yearn for more than just revenge or retribution.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: And my daughter laid her maiden life on its altar, so please win.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Russia's security service accuses Ukraine's secret services of killing Tugina. Investigators have opened a murder case. Kyiv denies the accusations. Ukraine surely doesn't have anything to do with yesterday's explosion because we're not a criminal state and we're not a terrorist state.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The presidential advisor also took to Twitter, saying Russian propaganda lives in a fictional world, and vipers in Russian special services started an intra-species fight.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The country says it's bracing for an intensification of Russian missile attacks to coincide with its independence day on Wednesday and in the aftermath of Degina's death.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Former U.S. President Donald Trump has filed his official response to the raid of his Mar-a-Lago estate in Florida by FBI agents. It's a lawsuit demanding that the documents seized by the Justice Department be overseen by a neutral third-party attorney known as a special master. The move cast the 8th of August search in which the FBI said it recovered 11 sets of classified documents from Trump's home as a shockingly aggressive move and asserts that the action took place even though Trump had been fully cooperative for weeks. Trump is being investigated for potentially mishandling documents.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: The Justice Department has countered in a brief three-sentence statement that the search had been authorised by a federal judge after the FBI showed there was probable cause to believe a crime had been committed.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: It said that it was responding court to the motion.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Germany's 10-year bond yield has hit a new four-and-a-half-week high.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: It follows fresh concern that disruption to European gas supplies will keep energy prices elevated, ensuring inflation stays high across the continent.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The European Commissioner for Eternal Market tweeted that he strongly advises everyone to limit the use of their air conditioner this summer.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: French supermarket retailer Carrefour is freezing prices on 100 everyday products.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Small businesses are already making their own sacrifices.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Before, we used to bake bread five times a day, but now we've cut back to three.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: We have organized ourselves differently.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: This means that special breads are baked with the baguettes instead of on their own.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: differently. This means that special breads are baked with the baguettes instead of on their own. But tightening the energy belt is not everyone's cup of tea.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: I think it's abusive. We do what we want at home. We pay for gas, electricity. We'll be cold. We'll put blankets on. We can always put on more jumpers, socks, mittens if we have to.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: In the UK, some electricity bills have nearly tripled in one year.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: A movement of people refusing to pay has gained momentum.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: £176. I'm going to put that money in a savings account.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Meanwhile in Italy, core inflation excluding energy has jumped to 4.1%.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: As Italy heads to the polls next month, candidates will be forced to reckon with the cost of living crisis.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The far-right brothers of Italy in coalition with Forza Italia and the Liga party are expected to come out top, with Giorgia Meloni set to become the next prime minister.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Our correspondent Giorgia Orlandi has more from Rome.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: For the first time in 100 years, Italy's general elections will be held in autumn.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: By 8pm on Monday, all main political parties had to submit their official candidates.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Now the electoral campaign, which is going to last a month, officially gets underway this week.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: You can tell by the campaign posters that you can see here in Rome. But the city is unusually empty. That's because most Italians are still on holiday. So this scenario is what awaits them when they come back to Italy's capital as well as to other cities across the country. Now among the main themes of these electoral campaign there is the energy crisis inflation migration and the war in Ukraine. Two main coalitions will be confronting each other on all these issues. One is THE ELECTIONS.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: THE ELECTIONS.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: THERE IS THE ENERGY CRISIS, INFLATION, MIGRATION AND THE WAR IN UKRAINE.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: TWO MAIN COALITIONS WILL BE CONFRONTING EACH OTHER ON ALL THESE ISSUES.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: ONE IS THE CENTER LEFT AND THE OTHER IS THE ONE LED BY THE RIGHT-WING PARTY. according to recent polls, is expected to get a clear majority at the next elections, although it's still a long way to go and anything can happen between now and the 25th of September.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Giorgio Orlandi for Euronews in Rome.
